page.title: 05MINING, PARK MILL 4.
page.content: MINERS ARE {NOT ALLOWED TO SMOKE} DOWN THE MINE. MINERS USE DAVY LAMPS BECAUSE THEY ARE SAFE AND CANNOT IGNITE AND CAUSE A GAS EXPLOSION. {PARK MILL COAL}IS USED MAINLY IN { {POWER STATIONS} TO MAKE ELECTRICITY. COAL CAN BE USED FOR MANY DIFFERENT THINGS. IT CAN BE BURNT ON A FIRE TO KEEP US WARM AND GIVE US HOT WATER. IT IS USED TO MAKE TAR FOR ROADS, PETROL, PAINT,PLASTICS, NYLON STOCKINGS AND IN ASPRINS TO CURE A HEADACHE. {COAL MINING TAKES PLACE NIGHT AND DAY} WITH MEN WORKING ON DIFFERENT SHIFTS. APART FROM MY 4.00 A.M. SHIFT, THERE IS A 5.30 A.M. SHIFT, WHICH IS A TEAM OF MEN WHO MAKE SURE THAT THE CONVEYORS ARE WORKING PROPERLY BEFORE THE MAIN 'DAY SHIFT' STARTS AT 6.45 A.M. THE 'DAY' SHIFT AND 'AFTERNOON' SHIFT, WHICH BEGINS AT 12.45 P.M. DO MAIN MINING WORK.
